article.description: Kirk Snyder scored 19 points as the Wolf Pack earned their first-ever NCAA Tournament win, 72-66 over Michigan State.
article.headline: Snyder scores 19, hits big late 3

inlines.body:
Dick Vitale's Tourney Take
Coach Tom Izzo's Spartans had their ups and downs this season, but that season came to an end in surprise fashion as Nevada rallied from a double-digit, second-half deficit. Nevada guard Kirk Snyder played like a man on a mission. He was not invited to a U.S. tryout when Michigan State's Chris Hill was, so Snyder had something to prove. The Spartans weren't the same after forward Paul Davis got into foul trouble. Davis ended up fouling out with 16 points. Nevada coach Trent Johnson, the former Stanford assistant, is one of the rising stars in the coaching fraternity.
More on Thursday's Games

article.story: EAST LANSING, Mich. (AP) -- Paul Davis had 18 points and 11 rebounds, and Drew Naymick blocked six shots in the first half, leading No. 13 Michigan State to a 98-56 victory over Division II Northern Michigan in an exhibition game Sunday. Maurice Ager added 18 points, and Alan Anderson had 15 points and 10 rebounds against Michigan State coach Tom Izzo's alma mater. Marco Volcy scored 11 points and Ricky Volcy and Jake Suardini added 10 each for the Wildcats, who were outrebounded 56-30. Michigan State also got 13 points from Kelvin Torbert and 11 each from Chris Hill and Shannon Brown. Michigan State also announced that freshman center Idong Ibok will miss four to six weeks with a broke left hand, an injury sustained Friday in practice. The Spartans open the regular season at home Friday night against Florida A&M.
